title: Wavelet Quantile Correlation Tutorial
text: Wavelet Quantile Correlation (WQC) powerful tool examining scale-specific dependence two time series different points distribution (e.g., tails median). combining maximal overlap discrete wavelet transform (MODWT) quantile correlation measures, WQC uncovers extreme central co-movements vary across time scales. wqca package implements WQC two user-friendly functions: quantile_correlation_analysis(x, y, quantiles, â€¦): Computes quantile correlations monte-carlo confidence intervals single X-Y pair. apply_quantile_correlation(data, quantiles, â€¦): Applies analysis across single X variables multiple Y series, returning consolidated data frame.

title: Wavelet Quantile Correlation Tutorial
code: library(wqca) set.seed(123) # Reference series plus two targets data <- data.frame(   x = rnorm(512),   y = 0.6 * rnorm(512) + 0.4 * rnorm(512),   z = rnorm(512) ) quantiles <- c(0.1, 0.5, 0.9) # Compute WQC up to 3 levels with 300 bootstrap sims res_df <- apply_quantile_correlation(data, quantiles, J = 3, n_sim = 300) # View top rows head(res_df)
